titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: What shall I need to draw my sword? The paper
Hath cut her throat already. No, 'tis slander;
Whose edge is sharper than the sword; whose tongue
Outvenoms all the worms of Nile;
Rides on the posting winds, and doth belie
Maids, matrons, nay, the secrets of the grave

body.p: I became faint & giddy as I corrected proofs in my study, & felt too unwell to attend the Choir–school Committee. Also I sent telegrams to Jarrow cancelling my engagement to give away prizes &c. in the Secondary School. It is extremely annoying.
Mrs Moule called at tea–time. She is evidently rather hustled by the non–appearance of the Bishop's letter in the "Times". It was sent off on Saturday.
